snippet: The man, Dejvid Mirkovic, 38, was arrested in October for arranging to cut off the heads of a judge and prosecutor and preserve them in formaldehyde as souvenirs.
abstract: Dejvid Mirkovic pleads guilty to conspiring to murder federal judge and prosecutor involved in fraud conviction of his close business associate Joseph Romano; Mirkovic, who faces up to 30 years in prison, was arrested in October 2012 after he arranged to pay two undercover federal agents posing as hit men $40,000 to cut off their heads and preserve them in formaldehyde as souvenirs.
lead_paragraph: The man, Dejvid Mirkovic, 38, was arrested in October for arranging to cut off the heads of a judge and prosecutor and preserve them in formaldehyde as souvenirs.

headline.seo: Man Pleads Guilty in Plot to Kill Federal Judge and Prosecutor
headline.main: Man Admits Guilt in Plot to Kill Judge and Prosecutor
headline.print_headline: Man Admits Guilt in Plot To Kill Judge And Lawyer
